pros: The atmosphere is really good, people are friendly but of course it all depends on the team you are working with as well.
cons: The salaries are not high, since it is academia and not industry and career progression is very slow.

pros: Many team building event, away days etc. Guest lecturers every week to learn about research being conducted elsewhere. Lots of funding so great labs with good equipment. Nice mix of people to work with.
cons: Intense research environment, only suits some!

review_title: Its been a good run.  Senior Management starting to diversify but needs more.  Better than most, not quite Google.
pros: very flexible, strives to be inclusive.
cons: The organisation could benefit by being more dynamic

pros:
Top notch research.
Great reputation and well linked with top conferences and institutions in the rest of the world
Great minds to work with and develop innovative ideas
Excellent  location
cons:
Not enough diversity between the people
Cant leave the science behind when  socializing

pros: Great projects to work on and top researchers to work with. You can even manage to get your name on a paper that is published.
cons: The pay isn't great for a research intern and sometimes you need to work longer hours.

pros: You work with the best student / staff. They have a wide network of worldwide connections, so plenty of opportunities to travel.
cons: Imperial is located in South Kensington, which is quite an expensive area in London. So high costs of living...

job_title: IT Support Specialist in Kensington, England
pros:
Great working environment, pension and basic salary.
Good place for progression and good holiday allowance.
cons: No staff parking during peak hours. Very weak HR. Upper management does not consider the type of place (Educational institute) when making decisions on change (Corporate).

pros: good location and excellent environment, museums and hyde park are nearby. The university has good facilities, including working, food and relaxing. People are very nice.
cons: Living nearby is very expensive, and the salary is similar to other universities in central London.

pros: Great range of research projects; Fantastic colleagues; Lots of opportunities for personal development.
cons: Little academic career certainty after PhD; Obtaining funding may be not easy; Work experience depends on the group and supervisor. These are characteristic of academia in general.

Some buildings are old or even if refurbished they have many infrasctructure problems;
Management is always looking for ways to make money of the students funding, or by cutting on important student facilities.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in London, England
pros: You get to work with teachers in professors to discuss the question sets and be able to teach to younger cohorts students.
cons: This role is alo so highly dependent on the students which come to sessions, and could be better organised.

job_title: Clinical Research Fellow in Paddington, England
pros: I have an excellent supervisor. The working hours are flexible. The department is very supportive.
cons: I have taken a salary cut as compared to working clinically full time. There are however opportunities to do additional work to supplement income

review_title: Life as a research at ICL
pros: Great opportunities, high level of research, fully flexible working hours
cons: Massive amount of work, little internal cooperation, crowded office space, cannot make any long term plan in London due to high cost of accommodation and living

pros:
The working hour is flexible and sometime is very high
annual leave can be taken in a big chunk
cons:
most of the Imperial campuses are not easily connected with public transport links
not many benefits as you can get from companies

pros: Working hours are very flexible. The payment is good, especially given someone is doing a PhD at the same time.
cons: The manager could be slightly pushy some times. The living expense near campus (central london) is quite high.

job_title: PhD Student in South Kensington, England
pros:
Great facilities including offices, IT services, sports centre.
Food is cheap.
People are nice to work with.
Good location, near museums and harrods.
cons:
Rent is really expensive.
Food is cheap but not good.
Campus is really small. 
During Lunch hour too many people in the campus.

pros:
Collaborative environment
State of the art facilities
Good financial resources
Plenty of seminars from international speakers
People are very friendly
cons:
Hammersmith Campus a bit isolated
No sport facilities apart from a gym very small and in the basement

pros: Flexible schedule, interesting job that helps the research on a humanitarian subject.
cons: The payments are not scheduled. Could work 3 months and get paid at once in the end of the period.

pros: High quality research and colleagues, state of the art equipment, positively challenging environment to be a student
cons: Usual downsides of a large institution, a lot of interia and some bureaucracy, obviously can be a lot of work

pros: Stimulating environment, loads of opportunities for great research
cons: sometimes it can feel a little bit overwhelming but that is because of the high quality of the peers you are surrounded by! So it is not a bad thing really

pros: Imperial has great resources and brilliant staff!
cons: The cohorts can be large and thus the researchers struggle to supervise you appropriately

pros: Great focus on innovation, very friendly staff and good food (for London standards). Also, fantastic location.
cons: Do not expect your university life to be easy, very hard degrees but also rewarding, as you feel you are really learning.

review_title: Full time staff and part time PhD student
pros: Very relaxed environment and lucky enough to have a good group, great support when I had to take maternity leave.
cons: Lack of childcare, no health benefits, long hours and high work load expectations

pros:
-Imperial is a very intellectually stimulating environment. 
-Lot of support available to staff for professional development. E.g. Postdoc Development Centre, Careers service.
-Global collaborations and links with industry
cons: -Most senior academic positions are full and very competitive.

job_title: Post Doctoral Research Assistant in London, England
pros: Great environment to develop a postdoc career. The University is really active and the Postdoc Development Center is a plus that can help you grow in your academic career.
cons: I haven't found any downside so far.

review_title: It was time to say Enough is enough...
job_title: Events Sales Assistant in London, England
pros: Good company to work for
cons: Managers: discrimination, favouritism, bullying - Not lead as example as they want to be seen

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in London, England
pros: Prestigious university with very good resources for cutting-edge research.
cons: Very competitive as far as universities go. It is an academic institution, so be prepared to earn little on a temporary contract.

review_title: Good environment for professional services staff
pros:
- Good work environment
- Opportunities for professional and personal development
cons: - We had trouble with a disruptive member of staff and it was difficult to fire them, even if they were in their probation period

pros: Relaxed environment, good location, learn a lot, good resources to carry out work.
cons: Perhaps there are too many admin staff. Reducing the pensions of the staff was also a poor decision.

pros: A lot of opportunities to develop, good admin staff. Quality research and a large network of academics to collaborate. Good connections with the industry.
cons: Teaching load might be rather heavy. Internal politics might become an issue.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros:
Great location in central London. 
Staffs and students are talented and active.
Lots of collaborations with companies and other research institutes worldwide.
Definitely a great place to learn and develop technologies.
cons: The living expense is a bit high.

pros: Imperial provides a great environment to learn. Received a lot of support with masters project. Excellent laboratory facilities in the new White City Campus.
cons: Heavy workload can makes it difficult to balance studies/work with social life.

job_title: Sales and Event Coordinator in South Kensington, England
pros: working hours, pay and holidays
cons: my role didn't consist of many client face to face interaction at all.

review_title: Not great currently avoid unless really desperate
job_title: Team Manager in South Kensington, England
pros: Pay generally remains above average
cons: Awful leadership from top and patchy/YMMV in individual departments. Waves of restructuring underway are both incompetently handled and brutal. Some facets illegal but it is not worth a legal solution for redress.

pros: Great reputation, working with some of the best minds in the field, central london, free gym
cons: very expensive to buy food and drink on campus, a lot of focus on making money rather than the student experience

review_title: Nice work environment in the city, with London's usual disadvantages.
job_title: PhD Student in South Kensington, England
pros: Nice campus, close to Hyde park, colleagues and students are generally clever and friendly.
cons: Nearby housing is unaffordable, transit is crowded, daycare (nursery) hours are short (8.45 - 17.15).

job_title: Research Associate in South Kensington, England
pros: London Salary and central location
cons: Shortage of lab space so serious that the work environment is hostile thanks to daily competition for space. Unreasonable spending of grant holder research funds. Expensive costs.

job_title: Student Finance Officer in London, England
pros: Very supportive environment, lots of skills training available.
cons: The length fo time something takes can be frustrating, it is very committee led, this sometimes means no decisions are made for years and there is no accountability.

pros: Quality of Research (Academic staff, talks, seminars, research groups). Infrastructures. Facilities. Career Service. Position (centre of London).
cons: Campus is a bit chaotic, also due to maintenance work.

review_title: Nice place, but works like a company
pros: They have the best students and researchers around the world. Good funding and great place within London. A lot of chance of getting beers within the university.
cons: Stressful place to work.

pros:
Very applied research project
Possibility to work closely with the industrial sponsor
Great working environment and support from the supervisor
cons:
None
Maybe the salary is a little too low considering living costs in London

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros: A great environment with everybody around me very friendly and most of them more intelligent than me. :)
cons: Salaries cannot be compared to the industry (at least for most computer science-related jobs).

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros: Good culture in the research group and very flexible policies on remote working.
cons: Postdoctoral research associates are paid poorly although this is a broader problem in the UK and not specific to Imperial College.

pros: Amazing researchers, great place to get exposure to the ideas of some of the best minds in the field.
cons: Expensive location, not everyone can afford living in the area.

review_title: Imperial College has given me all the tools required for a successful entry into the job market

cons: more focus could be placed on research and postgraduate students

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England

cons: Financial and bureaucratic processes can be awful, depending on your department; public sector payscales

review_title: I have been working as full PhD student in the Aeronautics department for three years.
job_title: PhD Student At Imperial College London in London, England
pros: Brilliant place to be. International environment. Good career opportunities.
cons: Salary too low for the cost of life. Very very competitive environment. Stressful job

review_title: A great stepping stone in a lot of careers
job_title: PhD Graduate Student in London, England

job_title: Post Doctoral Research Associate in London, England

review_title: Overall this is a great place to work.
pros: Diverse, international, welcoming and interdisciplinary. Great place for computational scientists.
cons: Salaries vs cost of living in London.

Outdated facilities currently

review_title: Good and friendly University to work with
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England

cons: Expensive to rent a place in London, High competition,

pros: Department of  Electrical and Electronic Engineering. Top researchers, an opportunity to learn from the best in the field. Fully recommend.
cons: Long hours, the building is a bit grim.

pros: Central location in the heart of London, great academic reputation & researchers

review_title: I found it a good place to work but as a PhD, it depends on on your PI

review_title: A fantastic place to work, full of opportunities
